articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Pyongyang Children's Foodstuff Factory
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Pyongyang Children's Foodstuff Factory
Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, inspected the modernized Pyongyang Children's Foodstuff Factory.
					 He saw the newly-built mosaic "The great leaders Comrade Kim Il Sung and Comrade Kim Jong Il examining foodstuff for children" and monument to field guidance of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Praising the officials and employees of the factory for having built well the mosaic with their strong will to convey the great leaders' love for posterity associated with the factory down through generations, he said President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il would be very glad to know that tasty and nutritious foodstuff for children are produced in a large quantity.
					
					 Kim Jong Un went round the newly-built room for education in the revolutionary history and room dedicated to the history of the factory.
					
					 He stressed the need for the officials and employees of the factory to intensify the education in the undying leadership feats of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and thus translate the desire of the great leaders into reality with great success in production.
					
					 Then he toured different parts of the factory to learn in detail about its modernization and production and the variety and quality of products.
					
					 Noting that all processes from raw material feeding to production, packaging, storage and delivery are automated and robotized, he expressed pleasure over the fact that the modernization of the factory in keeping with requirement of the age of knowledge-based economy totally freed employees from toilsome work and made it possible to raise the productivity by leaps and bounds with less manpower.
					
					 The modernization of the factory is very admirable, he said, adding: It is thanks to the creative wisdom and unyielding spirit of our workers, scientists and technicians and the great potentiality of our machine-building industry that the huge modernization project could be finished on a high level in one year.
					
					 What pleased him in particular in modernizing the factory is the fact that each production process is equipped with up-to-date facilities designed by our scientists and technicians and made by our own efforts, he said, stressing that localization constitutes the core of the Party's policy on modernization.
					
					 He said that when some people with proclivity to import visit the factory, their import mania would completely be cured.
					
					 He highly appreciated the feats of officials, scientists, technicians and workers who made positive contribution to the modernization of the factory and gave thanks in the name of the Workers' Party of Korea to them.
					
					 He said that many officials in Pyongyang and local areas should visit the factory to learn from it.
					
					 He posed for a picture with the officials and employees of the factory, expressing belief that they would produce in larger quantity soya milk and other tasty and nutritious foodstuff for children.
					
					 Accompanying him were secretaries Kim Yang Gon and O Su Yong and vice department director Jo Yong Won of the Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee.

articles.title: Greetings to Palestinian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Palestinian President
Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a message of greeting to Mahmoud Abbas, president of the State of Palestine, chairman of the Executive Committee of the Palestine Liberation Organization and chief of the Palestinian National Authority, on the occasion of the 27th anniversary of proclamation of the State of Palestine. 
					 In the message Kim Yong Nam sincerely wished the Palestinian president success in his responsible work, believing that the just cause of the Palestinian people for regaining the legitimate national rights including right to establish an independent state will surely emerge victorious.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Lebanese FM
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Lebanese FM
Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong sent a message of sympathy to Minister of Foreign Affairs and Immigrants of Lebanon Gebran Bassil on November 14 as regards the outrageous terrorism that claimed many people in Lebanon.
					 The message extended deep condolence and sympathy to the government, people and bereaved families of victims of Lebanon and expressed solidarity with the government and people of Lebanon in their efforts to achieve the socio-political security and unity of the country.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets Angolan President
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets Angolan President
Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Ri Su Yong, foreign minister of the DPRK who is leading its government delegation to participate in the celebrations of the 40th anniversary of the independence of Angola and pay an official visit to it, met Angolan President Jose Eduardo Dos Santos at the presidential palace on November 12. 
					 The Angolan president extended deep thanks to Marshal Kim Jong Un for sending the DPRK government delegation to the celebrations. 
					
					 He said he would always remember President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, eternal leaders of the Korean people, recalling the unsparing support sent by them to Angola in the struggle to achieve its independence and build a new society. 
					
					 He referred to the militant friendship and relations of friendship and cooperation between Angola and the DPRK with a long history and tradition, which were forged by the preceding leaders of the two countries, and are now growing stronger in all fields under the deep care of Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 It is the firm will of Angola to steadily develop the relations of friendship and cooperation with the DPRK in various fields, he said, adding that Angola will boost mutual support and cooperation with the DPRK in the non-aligned movement and other international arenas.

articles.title: Talks Held between FM of DPRK and Angolan Minister for External Relations
articles.content:
Talks Held between FM of DPRK and Angolan Minister for External Relations
Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- There took place talks between Ri Su Yong, foreign minister of the DPRK who is leading the delegation of the DPRK government to take part in the celebrations of the 40th anniversary of Angolan independence and pay an official visit to Angola, and Georges Rebelo Pinto Chikoty, minister for External Relations of Angola, at the ministry building on November 12. 
					Present there from the DPRK side were members of the DPRK delegation and the DPRK ambassador to Angola and from the Angolan side officials concerned of the Ministry for External Relations. 
					
					The talks discussed the issues of boosting the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries in different fields.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets Foreign State and Government Heads
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets Foreign State and Government Heads
Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Ri Su Yong, foreign minister of the DPRK who is leading its government delegation to the celebrations of the 40th anniversary of independence of Angola, met with foreign state and government heads on November 11. 
					 President of the Republic of Mozambique Filipe Nwussi said the relations between the two countries are historic ones provided by the great leaders of the DPRK and the preceding leaders of Mozambique, expressing the will to boost mutual support and cooperation in the non-aligned movement and other international arenas. 
					
					 Jacob Gedleyihlekisa Zuma, president of the Republic of South Africa, said the Korean people have extended consistent support to the struggle of the South African people, stressing the need to boost the relations of economic cooperation already developing on good terms. 
					
					 Ri Su Yong also met respectively the prime ministers of Mali and Cape Verde. 
					
					 He also met Salvador Antonio Valdes Mesa, vice-president of the Council of State of Cuba, and had a talk on the same day. 
					
					 Salvador Antonio Valdes Mesa said he witnessed the successes made by the Korean people in the building of a socialist economic power under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un when visiting the DPRK to attend the celebrations for the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea. He expressed his will to make every effort to further develop bilateral relations between the two countries.

articles.title: 71st Plenary Meeting of C.C., DWUK Held
articles.content:
71st Plenary Meeting of C.C., DWUK Held
Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- There took place the enlarged 71st plenary meeting of the Central Committee of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea (DWUK) in Pyongyang Saturday.
					 Attending the meeting were members and alternate members of the Central Committee of the DWUK and officials of the women's union organizations in Pyongyang and local areas.
					
					 It discussed the issue of greeting the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea with high political enthusiasm and unprecedented labor achievements.
					
					 Kim Jong Sun, chairwoman of the Central Committee of the DWUK, made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					 They proposed tasks and ways for greeting the 7th Congress of the WPK with signal achievements.
					
					 They underscored the need to glorify for all ages the feats President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il performed for the development of the WPK and the revolution, eternally holding them in high esteem, and devotedly protect Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 They called on all officials and members of the union to fully display the fighting efficiency and might of the women's union in the struggle to glorify the 7th Congress of the WPK as a great event in ushering in a heyday of the revolution to be specially recorded in the history of the WPK, rallied close around Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Fourth Meeting of Frontrankers of Three-Revolution Red Flag Movement to Be Held
articles.content:
Fourth Meeting of Frontrankers of Three-Revolution Red Flag Movement to Be Held
Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- The Fourth Meeting of Frontrankers of the Three-Revolution Red Flag Movement will be held in Pyongyang late in November.
					 The meeting will review the achievements and experience gained in the three-revolution red flag movement in the past period and discuss the tasks and ways of developing the movement on a higher stage in all fields and units as required by the modeling of the whole society on Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spreads to Merited Intellectuals
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spreads to Merited Intellectuals
Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un sent birthday spreads to Jong Ki Jong, 70, winner of Order of Kim Il Sung and Kim Il Sung Prize who is a writer at the April 15 Literary Production Centre; Prof. and Dr. Pak U Sop, 70, candidate academician and teacher at Hamhung University of Chemical Engineering; Prof. and Dr. Song Han Jong, 70, candidate academician and teacher at Wonsan University of Fisheries; and Prof. and Dr. Han Pyong Jun, 90, winner of the title of People's Scientist and chief of office at Kim Chaek University of Technology. 
					 Jong Ki Jong wrote many cycles of novels and full-length and medium-length novels, making a great contribution to educating service personnel, people and school youth and children. 
					
					 Pak U Sop has remained faithful to the party and the leader with high ability, invariably working heart and soul to educate the younger generation. 
					
					 Song Han Jong wrote more than 20 kinds of textbooks and reference books, contributing to training talents in the field of fisheries. 
					
					 Han Pyong Jun explored several major subjects and wrote dozens of kinds of textbooks and reference books, while devoting all his wisdom and enthusiasm to the study of education science.

articles.title: Pyongyang Catfish Farm
articles.content:
Pyongyang Catfish Farm
Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Catfish Farm has been remodeled into a standard one in less than one year as part of the DPRK's efforts to put the production, construction and management of all fields and units of the country on a Juche, modern and scientific basis.
					 The farm achieved such successes as putting all its production processes on a high scientific, intensive and industrial level.
					
					 Scientists, technicians and employees of the farm and relevant units established an integral production system and built the combined control room, hatchery, open-air pond and cold storage in the farm as required by the Workers' Party of Korea's policy of manpower- and water-saving style pisciculture.
					
					 The application of natural energy also makes it possible to produce catfish in all seasons.
					
					 On the basis of such achievements, the farm doubled the production of catfish this year, saving manpower and volume of water.
					
					 When giving field guidance to the farm in October, supreme leader Kim Jong Un appraised the farm for completing its modernization by its own efforts.

articles.title: Class of Scientific Research Prize Winners
articles.content:
Class of Scientific Research Prize Winners
Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Hyong Jik University of Education in the DPRK has recently produced a class of winners of University Student Scientific Research Prize, the first of its kind among universities of education and teacher training colleges.
					 When interviewed by KCNA, Kim Myong Jin, teacher of the class, said:
					
					 I adopted detailed and various education methods to be responsive to every student.
					
					 Through broad discussion with students, I tried to make my students fully digest what they learnt and hit upon new ideas.
					
					 Over ten programs coded by my students won high appraisal at the 6th national exhibition of IT achievements made by university students held last year.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Discloses Aim Sought by U.S. Warmonger in Touting "Peaceful Unification" of Korea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Discloses Aim Sought by U.S. Warmonger in Touting "Peaceful Unification" of Korea
Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- The chief of Staff of the U.S. Army recently said that there is great likelihood that south and north of Korea speaking the same language as a homogeneous nation would be one country any time in the future and the unification may be achieved in a violent manner, but the U.S. wants to see "peaceful unification." He, at the same time, expressed sham concern, uttering that the Korean Peninsula is the region where there is no genuine peace as it has the densest deployment of heavily armed troops in the world and if a small conflict between the south and the north leads to a large-scale war, it will spark a tragic disaster. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Saturday observes in a commentary in this regard: The U.S. warmonger's talk about peaceful reunification is unpardonable insult and mockery of the Koreans who have aspired after reunification for several decades. 
					
					 Disclosing the U.S. military boss's sinister intention of giving impression that Washington is interested in peace and reunification of the peninsula, the commentary goes on:
					
					 The DPRK's fair proposal for concluding a peace treaty enjoys unanimous support at home and abroad. International public urges the U.S., the arch criminal ratcheting up tension on the peninsula, to opt for building lasting peace-keeping mechanism as soon as possible. 
					
					 This is driving the U.S. into an awkward position as it is beefing up its armed forces to establish domination over Northeast Asia and Asia-Pacific region by containing big powers and ceaselessly expanding the sphere of its influence. The U.S. felt the need to seek a way out of the situation and subterfuge to justify its actions. So, the U.S. military boss talked rubbish about "peaceful unification" of Korea vociferating about the non-existent "provocation" from the DPRK. It is the U.S. trick to cover up its criminal intention of denying the DPRK's proposal for concluding a peace treaty and play down the validity of the proposal through peace rhetoric. 
					
					 If the U.S. is truly interested in the peace on the peninsula, it should stop escalating tension and respond to the above-said fair proposal of the DPRK.

articles.title: S. Korean "Saenuri Party" Representative's Anti-DPRK Remarks Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean "Saenuri Party" Representative's Anti-DPRK Remarks Slammed
Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Representative of south Korean "Saenuri Party" Kim Mu Song in a special lecture on Nov. 9 blustered that defeat in the showdown over the introduction of "state-compiled" history textbook will lead to a ruin and queried how north Koreans will think of us if we lose in it. He went the lengths of even talking hoarse about the "end" of someone, recalling the collapse of socialist countries in Eastern Europe. 
					 Minju Joson Saturday in a commentary says: It is something resentful that Kim Mu Song openly disclosed his ambition for escalating the confrontation of social systems, being buoyed by his wild dream.
					
					 What he uttered is nothing but a despicable trick to seek a way out, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 In fact, it is the conservative ruling forces themselves who are precipitating their own ruin.
					
					 A clear proof of it is their rapidly sinking position as they have had their back turned on the people from the very day they came to power.
					
					 This time the conservative ruling forces are digging deeper their graves by moving to introduce "state-compiled" history textbook. Needless to say, if this thing is allowed to go on, the conservative ruling forces will meet their ruin earlier, far from realizing their ambition for staying in power.
					
					 Kim Mu Song who eyes the post of "president" for the next term floated the story of the "forces following the north" as a stopgap measure for tiding over the unfavorable situation. His talk about the "forces following the north" can never become a step-stone for the top class pro-U.S. lackey in coming to power. We warn Kim once again he will not be able to find any place to be buried on this land, far from seeking "presidency," if he pays no heed to our warnings.

articles.title: Struggle against Dictatorial Regime Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Struggle against Dictatorial Regime Called for in S. Korea
Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Voice of People, south Korean internet newspaper, in an editorial on Nov. 13 called for turning out in actions for punishing the traitorous "regime."
					 The editorial disclosed that the present regime came into being through a rigged election with the help of power bodies including the Intelligence Service.
					
					 The ruling mode is completely authoritarian, the editorial said, denouncing the present chief executive for trying to rewrite history textbooks at her will.
					
					 The plan for an all-out people's action on Nov. 14 is an eruption of the anger of the people at the tyrannical rule, the editorial noted.
					
					 The security authorities are threatening to take legal actions against the participants in the actions while setting police in motion and building barricades in the streets, the editorial said, terming it an expression of arrogance aimed to block the eruption of the people's resentment.
					
					 The only way for getting rid of the dictatorial rule is the might of the people, the editorial said, calling on people of all social standings to turn out in the all-out people's action.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Nigerian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Nigerian Organization
Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted an article titled "Mt. Paektu and Kim Jong Il" on its website on Nov. 6.
					 The article said:
					
					 Mt. Paektu called an ancestral mountain of the Korean nation and holy mountain of the Korean revolution would be unthinkable apart from leader Kim Jong Il, eternal chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					
					 Kim Jong Il was born in Mt. Paektu, the base of the anti-Japanese armed struggle, on Feb. 16, 1942.
					
					 At that time anti-Japanese fighters wrote on the barked trees in thick forests the letters "Oh, we herald the birth of the shining star of Mt. Paektu" and "Long live the shining star shedding brilliant rays all over country," etc. hoping to see him become a shining star of Korea by succeeding to the cause of President Kim Il Sung, sun of the nation.
					
					 Entering Kim Il Sung University, he wrote a poem "O Korea, I Will Add Glory to Thee." It reflects his noble will to lead Korea to bright future with responsibility, carrying forward the intention of the President.
					
					 He turned the DPRK into an invincible socialist power true to his faith and will. 
					
					 The article cited stories about the roaring thunder over Jong Il Peak, introducing the great personality of the peerlessly brilliant commander. It added that the august name and exploits of NDC Chairman Kim Jong Il would last forever together with sacred Mt. Paektu.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Slovakia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Slovakia
Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- A Slovak committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed on November 9.
					 Ivan Draxler, chairman of the Slovak Association for Supporting the Juche Idea, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to significantly organize political and cultural events praising Kim Jong Il's revolutionary career and exploits on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Mirae Scientists Street Introduced by German Company
articles.content:
Mirae Scientists Street Introduced by German Company
Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- The MS Travel Company of Germany posted an article titled "Newly-built street in Pyongyang" accompanied with photos introducing the Mirae Scientists Street on its website on Nov. 10.
					 The article said:
					
					 There appeared magnificent and fashionable Mirae Scientists Street along the picturesque bank of the River Taedong. Skyscrapers and blocks of apartment houses stand there in good harmony.
					
					 Each flat has a drawing room, parents' room, room for couple, children's room, kitchen, etc. and is furnished with high-quality furniture and fixtures. The apartment houses are surrounded by resting places and sports parks for residents. They boast peculiar greening.
					
					 Ordinary educators and scientists are provided with these de luxe flats free of charge.
					
					 The Mirae Scientists Street was built under the loving care of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He set forth a task of forming a street with the block of apartment houses for the educators of Kim Chaek University of Technology in the center and named it the Mirae Scientists Street.
					
					 The street represents monumental structures of Songun era demonstrating the might of socialist Korea.
					
					 The article was illustrated with more than 10 photos showing the panoramic view of the street and interior of flats.

articles.title: Danish Queen Hopes for Boosting Friendly and Cooperative Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Danish Queen Hopes for Boosting Friendly and Cooperative Relations with DPRK
Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Kang Yong Dok, DPRK ambassador to Denmark, presented his credentials to Danish Queen Margrethe ll on November 6.
					 The Queen hoped that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop on good terms.

articles.title: Decision of Political Bureau of C.C., WPK Supported by Beninese Organizations
articles.content:
Decision of Political Bureau of C.C., WPK Supported by Beninese Organizations
Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- The Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader" and the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea made public a joint statement on Nov. 6 in support of the decision of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 The statement said:
					
					 The Korean people are accelerating their general offensive for building a thriving socialist nation in the high spirit of victors who have demonstrated the dignity and might of the great Paektusan nation.
					
					 The Political Bureau of the C.C., WPK released a decision to convene the 7th Congress of the WPK early in May next year.
					
					 The WPK has formed unbreakable kinship with the popular masses by pursuing benevolent politics of love and trust and all-embracing politics and worked hard to provide the people with a bountiful and happy life.
					
					 The 7th Congress of the WPK will mark an epoch-making occasion in laying a new landmark in the struggle of the Korean people to add glory to the tradition of victory in the confrontation with imperialism that has lasted for centuries, honorably safeguard the dignity and sovereignty of the country and gains of the revolution, achieve prosperity of the country and accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 We wish the great Korean people bigger successes in their struggle to build a thriving socialist nation, achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country and bring earlier the final victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche, united close around the party and the leader in thinking and purpose.

articles.title: Guinean National Committee for Study of Juche Idea Renamed
articles.content:
Guinean National Committee for Study of Juche Idea Renamed
Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held in Guinea on November 6 to rename the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea the Guinean National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.
					 Present there were figures and members of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Guinean Society for the Study of the Juche Literary Idea, the Society for the Study of the Juche Farming Method at the Kim Il Sung Institute of Agricultural Science in Guinea, the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea at the Kankan University, the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Conakry, the Guinean Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Society and the Guinea-Korea Friendship Association.
					
					 Participants in the meeting laid a floral basket before the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Riyad Chaloub, chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, said that Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism is a permanent guiding idea of humankind, adding that it is a noble duty of the progressive mankind including Guinean adherents to the Juche idea to deeply study and widely disseminate Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.
					
					 Banou Keita, chairman of the Guinea-Korea Friendship Association, noted that Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism is important guidelines to be always held fast in the struggle for defending independence.
					
					 The quintessence of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism is the Juche idea and the Songun idea, he said, adding:
					
					 In the future, I will conduct the work for studying and disseminating Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism in close combination with the activities for supporting the Korean people in their just cause.
					
					 A letter to Marshal Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige en terreno Fabrica de Alimentos para Ninos de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige en terreno Fabrica de Alimentos para Ninos de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 14 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un dirigio sobre el terreno la Fabrica de Alimentos para Ninos de Pyongyang donde se ha realizado completamente la modernizacion.
					Recorrio el mural de mosaicos "El gran Lider, camarada Kim Il Sung y el gran Dirigente, camarada Kim Jong Il viendo los alimentos para ninos " y el Monumento en memoria de la visita de orientacion de los grandes hombres sin pares, recientemente construidos en el recinto.
					
					El Mariscal dijo que los funcionarios y los empleados de la fabrica construyeron bien el mural de mosaico desplegando ardiente fidelidad de transmitir de generacion en generacion el amor a los ninos, miembros de la nueva generacion de los grandes lideres, impregnado en la fabrica, y agrego con emocion que estos estarian muy alegres si se producen y se suministran en gran cantidad a los ninos los alimentos sabrosos y nutritivos.
					
					Estuvo en la sala de educacion en la historia revolucionaria y el salon de presentacion del historial nuevamente remodelados.
					
					Encomendo que hay que efectuar bien la educacion mediante las inmortales hazanas de direccion de los grandes hombres para que los funcionarios y empleados de la fabrica logren grandes exitos productivos para convertir en realidad el deseo de ellos.
					
					Al recorrer varios lugares de la fabrica se entero detalladamente del estado de modernizacion, de produccion y de las variedades y la calidad de los productos.
					
					Menciono que fueron realizados la automatizacion y el control sin piloto en todos los procesos desde el metimiento de las materias primas, la produccion, el embalaje, el almacenamiento hasta el transporte y se regocijo diciendo que por el resultado de haber realizado la modernizacion de la fabrica conforme a la demanda de la epoca de economia intelectual, los obreros fueron liberados completamente de los trabajos duros y pueden elevar vertiginosamente la capacidad productiva ahorrando al maximo la mano de obra.
					
					Elogiando altamente la modernizacion de la fabrica asevero que este exito logrado en un ano se debe a la inteligencia creativa y el indomable poderio espiritual de los obreros, cientificos y tecnicos y la gran potencialidad de la industria de construccion de maquinaria de Corea.
					
					Senalo que lo que mas le gusta en la modernizacion de la fabrica es que todos los procesos productivos estan equipados con las instalaciones de punta, disenadas por nuestros cientificos y tecnicos y elaboradas con sus propias fuerzas y volvio a enfatizar en que el problema importantisimo en la orientacion del partido sobre la modernizacion es precisamente el principio de utilizar los productos nacionales.
					
					Si algunos hombres acostumbrados a mirar a otros paises visitan esta fabrica, quitaran completamente sus enfermedades de importacion.
					
					El Mariscal califico altamente a los funcionarios, cientificos, tecnicos y obreros quienes hicieron un activo aporte a la modernizacion de la fabrica y les dio agradecimiento en nombre del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					
					Hablo de la necesidad de organizar la visita a la fabrica para muchos funcionarios del centro y las localidades.
					
					Expreso la esperanza y conviccion de que los funcionarios y empleados de la fabrica produciran y suministraran mucho mas los alimentos sabrosos y nutritivos incluyendo la leche de soya a los ninos y se fotografio junto a ellos.
					
					Le acompanaron los secretarios del CC del PTC Kim Yang Gon y O Su Yong, y el subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC Jo Yong Won.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion a Mahmoud Abbas
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion a Mahmoud Abbas
Pyongyang, 14 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 14 un mensaje de felicitacion al jefe de la Autoridad Nacional de Palestina, Mahmoud Abbas, con motivo del 27o aniversario de la proclamacion del Estado de Palestina. 
					Convencido de que triunfara sin falta la justa causa del pueblo palestino por rescatar los legitimos derechos nacionales incluso la fundacion de un Estado independiente, el remitente deseo de todo corazon exitos en las responsabilidades del destinatario.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong se reune con Jose Eduardo Dos Santos
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong se reune con Jose Eduardo Dos Santos
Pyongyang, 14 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El canciller de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ri Su Yong, jefe de la delegacion gubernamental de la RPDC, que participo en las actividades por la independencia de Angola y realizo una visita oficial a este pais africano, se reunio el dia 12 en el palacio presidencial con el presidente de la Republica de Angola, Jose Eduardo Dos Santos.
					En la ocasion, el mandatario africano expreso agradecimiento a Su Excelencia Kim Jong Un por haber enviado la delegacion gubernamental a las actividades por el 40o aniversario de la independencia de Angola.
					
					Dijo que no puede olvidar a Su Excelencia Kim Il Sung y Su Excelencia Kim Jong Il, quienes enviaron el apoyo y la ayuda sinceros a la independencia de Angola y la construccion de nueva sociedad.
					
					Menciono que la fraternidad combativa y las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion de larga historia y tradicion entre Angola y la RPDC preparadas por los lideres antecedentes de los dos paises, se amplian y se desarrollan en todas las esferas bajo la atencion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					Tras afirmar que Angola tiene la firme voluntad de  desarrollar sin cesar y multilateralmente las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion con la RPDC, enfatizo que su pais fortalecera el apoyo y cooperacion mutuo con la RPDC en el Movimiento de los No Alineados y otras escenas internacionales.
					
					En la cita estuvieron presentes los miembros de la delegacion y el embajador en este pais africano, por la parte coreana y por la otra, el secretario encargado de los asuntos diplomaticos del presidente y el asistente de la oficina de los asuntos diplomaticos.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong se reune con jefes de Estado y gobierno de varios paises
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong se reune con jefes de Estado y gobierno de varios paises
Pyongyang, 14 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El ministro de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ri Su Yong, jefe de la delegacion gubernamental de la RPDC, que participo en las actividades por el 40o aniversario de la independencia de Angola, se reunio el dia 11 con los jefes de Estado y gobierno de varios paises.
					El presidente de la Republica de Mozambique Filipe Nwussi expreso su voluntad de fortalecer el apoyo y la cooperacion mutuos en las escenas internacionales inclusive el Movimiento de los No Alineados, al cabo de decir que las relaciones entre ambos paises son el vinculo historico, preparado juntos por los lideres coreanos y los dirigentes antecedentes de Mozambique.
					
					El presidente de la Republica Sudafricana Jacob Gedleyihlekisa Zuma senalo que el pueblo coreano expreso invariablemente el apoyo y solidaridad con la lucha del pueblo sudafricano y agrego en la necesidad de desarrollar mas las favorables relaciones de cooperacion economica entre ambos  paises.
					
					El canciller coreano se reunio tambien con el premier de la Republica de Mali y la de Cabo Verde.
					
					El mismo dia, el ministro coreano departio con el vicepresidente del Consejo de Estado de la Republica de Cuba, Salvador Antonio Valdes Mesa.
					
					El cubano recordo que durante su visita a la RPDC para participar en las actividades por el 70o aniversario de la fundacion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, vio con sus propios ojos los exitos alcanzados por el pueblo coreano en la construccion de la potencia economica socialista bajo la direccion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					Dio enfasis en que hara todo lo posible para ampliar y desarrollar mas las relaciones bilaterales entre ambos paises.
